instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage. Just the fan spinning fast. Heatpipe 2 and heatpipe outgoing air 128C Replaced <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> with no change. 

<RESISTOR>R5360</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5361</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> all measure well. Continuity is good as well to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>

What else can cause it? Using known good trackpad and cable

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Try known good LIO board/cable.
Inspect LIO connector for corroded pins.
Also try disconnecting webcam...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Already using known good LIO board/cable. LIO connector does not have any corroded pins.
Webcam disconnected didnâ€™t make a difference

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Compare HWMonitor readings with working board; can be 00165.
I think some heatpipe temp is reported 128 normally.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message: What else could make fan spin fast then? Thermal paste is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Try another trackpad board/flex.
Inspect tracpad connector pins.
Monitor current and voltage sensors too.
Fan starts fast, or increases the speed in seconds?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Using known good trackpad and flex. Trackpad connector pins are good.

fan increases the speed in seconds

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
